1da12cf882252477fd560bc0c77d357a (04:44): hi i wanted to ask how i can move the cursor with the arrows and the red point
5b9bd915f5cc98ca5d4f3b0b5d2c18da (04:44): The "widget" has colored arrows.  Drag those arrows or the white ring around it.
5b9bd915f5cc98ca5d4f3b0b5d2c18da (04:45): The "cursor" is a small candy-striped ring.  Click other places to move it.

1da12cf882252477fd560bc0c77d357a (04:46): halley: no i meant this "widget" but i wnat it in zero of coordinates, dont want to change the objekt witch is linked to it when i click on arrow and move e.g.
5b9bd915f5cc98ca5d4f3b0b5d2c18da (04:46): The widget is a part of the selection, it has no reason to exist anywhere if nothing is selected, and it controls the selection.
5b9bd915f5cc98ca5d4f3b0b5d2c18da (04:47): You can move the cursor to a place numerically with the View > Properties menu item.
5b9bd915f5cc98ca5d4f3b0b5d2c18da (04:47): You can move the widget (and thus the selection) numerically with the keyboard or the pup that appears on the N key.
5b9bd915f5cc98ca5d4f3b0b5d2c18da (04:48): You can move the widget TO the cursor, and vice versa, which is helpful in positioning things carefully.
a4009c2895d857e79caebfd744c8a062 (04:49): How goeth it, Mr. halley? :o
